personalInfo.education: University of New Mexico (1998 Business and Human Resources)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Web.com Tour Past Champion/5-10 Years
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Made the cut in five of 12 PGA TOUR starts, ending the season No. 200 in the FedExCup standings, the cutoff to make the Web.com Tour Finals. Season-best finish on TOUR came in August at the Barracuda Championship, a T27 in the Modified Stableford scoring format in Reno...In 10 Web.com Tour starts, made nine cuts. Lone top-25, a T19, came in June at the United Leasing Championship. Made the cut in all four Web.com Tour Finals' events (T32, T41, T46 and 76th), but it was not enough to regain exempt PGA TOUR status.

2013: Made 14 of 23 PGA TOUR cuts but was unable to record a top-10. Finished No. 147 in the FedExCup standings. Best finish was T18 at the FedEx St. Jude Classic...Last TOUR top-10 came in 2008. 

2012: Was T13 at the Web.com Tour Championship, placing him 24th on the final money list and giving him 2013 PGA TOUR playing privileges. Finished the year sixth in Driving Accuracy Percentage...Fired an opening round 65 at the Winn Dixie Jacksonville Open and held a one shot lead after the first round. Rounds of 70-74-71 resulted in his finishing T15. Held the lead on the front nine of the final round of the Mexico Open before stumbling over his final 15 holes to T17...Took a share of the first-round lead at the Utah Championship but was five shots back when the final round began. Made a key birdie on No. 16 at Willow Creek CC then made another difficult up and down from behind the green on the par-3 18th, including a clutch 5-foot par putt, to post a 15-under score. When nobody could match that number, he had his second career Web.com Tour victory and first in six years.

2011: Made the cut in 10 of 23 starts with seven top-25 finishes and a pair of top-10s...Wound up T4 at the Fresh Express Classic, a tournament reduced to 54 holes when the final round was ultimately canceled due to heavy fog in the late afternoon...Added a T6 at the Children's Hospital Classic in October, thanks to an 8-under 64 in the final round. 2010: Made the cut in 19 of 27 starts and ended the year No. 57 on the money list...In his fifth start of the year, posted his first top-10 finish of the year, at the Fresh Express Classic at TPC Stonebrae. He posted four rounds in the 60s, including a second-round 63, en route to a fourth-place finish, his best Web.com Tour performance since winning the 2006 Price Cutter Charity Championship...Recorded his second top-10 finish 18 starts later, at the WNB Golf Classic. Made the 36-hole cut on the number at 3-under 141 (T50), before shooting the low-round of the day, a 7-under 65, on Saturday to move to T11. Bettered his position to T8 after a final-round 68. 2009: Made 10 cuts in 24 starts on the Web.com Tour, with his best efforts a T12 at the Fort Smith Classic and a T15 at the Stonebrae Classic. 2008: Ended year No. 175 on the PGA TOUR money list, making 11 cuts in 22 starts, including three top-20 finishes. 2007: Finished 138th on the money list and recorded his first career top-10 during his rookie season. In first career start as a PGA TOUR member, posted rounds of 66-65 on the weekend to finish T4 at the Sony Open in Hawaii, five shots behind champion Paul Goydos. It was his first made cut in his fourth career start on TOUR. Birdied the 72nd hole to finish T48 at The Barclays, the first of the four PGA TOUR Playoffs events, to move from 121st to 120th in the standings, thereby qualifying for the next week's Deutsche Bank Championship. He was 25 points better than Steve Allan, who missed the cut in New York. 2006: Finished 15th on the Web.com Tour money list to earn his rookie PGA TOUR card for 2007. Among his four top-10s was a T3 at the LaSalle Bank Open and his first career victory at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. Finished the event at 27-under-par 267, the second-lowest score in relation to par in Tour history. 2005: Finished 53rd on the Web.com Tour money list, including the second runner-up finish of his career, one shot behind tournament winner Jason Gore at the National Mining Association Pete Dye Classic. 2004: Ranked 44th on the Web.com Tour money list. Had his best showing of the season with a third-place performance at the Cox Classic. 2003: Finished his Web.com Tour rookie season 41st on the money list, thanks to a pair of top-five showings. Solo third at the Knoxville Open and a T2 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. Missed the cut in his first three career appearances on the PGA TOUR.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Two-time All-American at New Mexico and a three-time all-conference selection.

tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made 14 of 23 PGA TOUR cuts but was unable to record a top-10. Finished No. 147 in the FedExCup standings. Best finish was T18 at the FedEx St. Jude Classic...Last TOUR top-10 came in 2008. 

2012: Was T13 at the Web.com Tour Championship, placing him 24th on the final money list and giving him 2013 PGA TOUR playing privileges. Finished the year sixth in Driving Accuracy Percentage...Fired an opening round 65 at the Winn Dixie Jacksonville Open and held a one shot lead after the first round. Rounds of 70-74-71 resulted in his finishing T15. Held the lead on the front nine of the final round of the Mexico Open before stumbling over his final 15 holes to T17...Took a share of the first-round lead at the Utah Championship but was five shots back when the final round began. Made a key birdie on No. 16 at Willow Creek CC then made another difficult up and down from behind the green on the par-3 18th, including a clutch 5-foot par putt, to post a 15-under score. When nobody could match that number, he had his second career Web.com Tour victory and first in six years.

2011: Made the cut in 10 of 23 starts with seven top-25 finishes and a pair of top-10s...Wound up T4 at the Fresh Express Classic, a tournament reduced to 54 holes when the final round was ultimately canceled due to heavy fog in the late afternoon...Added a T6 at the Children's Hospital Classic in October, thanks to an 8-under 64 in the final round. 

2010: Made the cut in 19 of 27 starts and ended the year No. 57 on the money list...In his fifth start of the year, posted his first top-10 finish of the year, at the Fresh Express Classic at TPC Stonebrae. He posted four rounds in the 60s, including a second-round 63, en route to a fourth-place finish, his best Web.com Tour performance since winning the 2006 Price Cutter Charity Championship...Recorded his second top-10 finish 18 starts later, at the WNB Golf Classic. Made the 36-hole cut on the number at 3-under 141 (T50), before shooting the low-round of the day, a 7-under 65, on Saturday to move to T11. Bettered his position to T8 after a final-round 68. 

2009: Made 10 cuts in 24 starts on the Web.com Tour, with his best efforts a T12 at the Fort Smith Classic and a T15 at the Stonebrae Classic. 

2008: Ended year No. 175 on the PGA TOUR money list, making 11 cuts in 22 starts, including three top-20 finishes. 

2007: Finished 138th on the money list and recorded his first career top-10 during his rookie season. In first career start as a PGA TOUR member, posted rounds of 66-65 on the weekend to finish T4 at the Sony Open in Hawaii, five shots behind champion Paul Goydos. It was his first made cut in his fourth career start on TOUR. Birdied the 72nd hole to finish T48 at The Barclays, the first of the four PGA TOUR Playoffs events, to move from 121st to 120th in the standings, thereby qualifying for the next week's Deutsche Bank Championship. He was 25 points better than Steve Allan, who missed the cut in New York. 

2006: Finished 15th on the Web.com Tour money list to earn his rookie PGA TOUR card for 2007. Among his four top-10s was a T3 at the LaSalle Bank Open and his first career victory at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. Finished the event at 27-under-par 267, the second-lowest score in relation to par in Tour history. 

2005: Finished 53rd on the Web.com Tour money list, including the second runner-up finish of his career, one shot behind tournament winner Jason Gore at the National Mining Association Pete Dye Classic. 

2004: Ranked 44th on the Web.com Tour money list. Had his best showing of the season with a third-place performance at the Cox Classic. 

2003: Finished his Web.com Tour rookie season 41st on the money list, thanks to a pair of top-five showings. Solo third at the Knoxville Open and a T2 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. Missed the cut in his first three career appearances on the PGA TOUR prior to his rookie season in 2007 (1997, 1999, 2003). 

Member of the Canadian Tour from 1999-2002. Member of the Australasian Tour in 2000-02. Amateur: Two-time All-American at New Mexico and a three-time all-conference selection.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 1st on the Web.com Tour 2 times.
